parameters.name: AcceptLanguage
parameters.description:
Specifies the language of the returned values of the **RegionName** and **ZoneName** parameters. Default value: zh. Valid values:

*   **zh**: Chinese.
*   **en**: English

parameters.name: DbType
parameters.description:
The database engine type of the instance. Valid values:

*   **normal**: replica set instance
*   **sharding**: sharded cluster instance

parameters.name: InstanceChargeType
parameters.description:
The billing method of the instance. Default value: PrePaid. Valid values:

*   **PrePaid**: subscription
*   **PostPaid**: pay-as-you-go

parameters.name: MongoType
parameters.description: The edition of the ApsaraDB for MongoDB instance. The instance can be of a high-availability edition or beta edition.

parameters.name: RegionId
parameters.description: The region ID of the instance. You can call the [DescribeRegions](~~61933~~) operation to query the latest available regions.

parameters.name: ResourceGroupId
parameters.description: The ID of the resource group. For more information, see [View basic information of a resource group](~~151181~~).

parameters.name: StorageSupport
parameters.description: The zones to be displayed. The values include the zones in which you can create an instance that uses cloud disks, the zones in which you can create an instance that uses local disks, and the zones in which you can create an instance that uses cloud disks and local disks.

parameters.name: StorageType
parameters.description:
The storage type of the instance. Valid values:

*   **cloud_essd1**: PL1.enhanced SSD (ESSD)
*   **cloud_essd2**: PL2 ESSD.
*   **cloud_essd3**: PL3 ESSD.
*   **local_ssd**: local SSD.

> 

*   Instances of MongoDB 4.4 and later only support cloud disks. **cloud_essd1** is selected if you leave this parameter empty.

*   Instances of MongoDB 4.2 and earlier support only local disks. **local_ssd** is selected if you leave this parameter empty.

parameters.name: ZoneId
parameters.description: The zone ID of the instance. You can call the [DescribeRegions](~~61933~~) operation to query available zones.
